## Checklist

Before submitting, ensure you have completed the following:

### Code Quality
- [ ] My code follows the project's coding standards
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have removed any debug/console logs

### Testing
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] I have tested the changes on multiple devices/Android versions

### Documentation
- [ ] I have updated the README.md (if applicable)
- [ ] I have updated the CHANGELOG.md
- [ ] I have updated relevant documentation in the `docs/` folder
- [ ] I have added/updated KDoc comments for public APIs

### Dependencies
- [ ] I have not introduced new dependencies
- [ ] OR: New dependencies are justified and documented below

### Accessibility
- [ ] UI changes include proper content descriptions
- [ ] UI is accessible via screen readers
- [ ] Color contrast meets accessibility standards

### Git
- [ ] My commits follow the project's commit message conventions
- [ ] I have rebased on the latest main branch
- [ ] There are no merge conflicts

## Additional Notes

Add any additional notes, concerns, or questions for reviewers.

What should reviewers focus on?
- Area 1
- Area 2
- Area 3
